title: Issues with Recording Replays
body:
So I made a very silly play in a game the other day that I wanted to record. When I tried to hit "record" in the replay feature, the screen immediately froze and I bugsplatted. I sent in an error report, and then I loaded back into the replay to try recording again. Once more, the screen froze, but then it took a second or two before bugsplatting. I sent in another error report. I tried a couple more times, each one ending in either immediate failure, or failure after a few seconds. No luck.

I tried again today, and I did have a little bit of success, in that I was able to record a couple clips, but they all just ended up having some weird static noises instead of the usual audio (Like this one: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2u4yhMFEr4E). I closed off the client and rebooted it and went back into the replay, but I'm now having the same bugsplatting issue that I was the other day. And here I am now.

I don't know if this is a common issue lately, but any assistance would be greatly appreciated! I know I sent in a couple bugsplats, but I'd like to have this resolved before the next patch lands, so I can still properly record this replay. Thanks for listening!

replies.body: We've been noticing that some players have been having this really odd noise popping up in their replays lately, and while we're still working on narrowing down exactly what's causing it, it seems to be happening when players have overlays or third party programs running in the background. I'd suggest doing a [**clean boot **](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974#wq7) and let me know if that noise is still there.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=gkdfyMEl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-07T03:44:44.041+0000)
>
> We've been noticing that some players have been having this really odd noise popping up in their replays lately, and while we're still working on narrowing down exactly what's causing it, it seems to be happening when players have overlays or third party programs running in the background. I'd suggest doing a [**clean boot **](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974#wq7) and let me know if that noise is still there.

I tried a clean boot, but I'm still having the bugsplat issue with that particular replay. I tried a different game's replay, and I was able to record a video, but it still had the crackling sound.

Try reaching out to our tech guys with that replay in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They'll be able to look into what's going on and make those replays a little more bearable.

Glad someone else is having this problem, was trying to capture a glitch where I was playing Yorick and a rammus somehow Q'd through my wall but then was uncontrollably placed back in it like a baby being put in a play pin.

Captured the video just fine except for once it actually bug splat on me, but every clip i've taken in the past 24ish hours has horrid pops and crackles with no actually game sound what so ever.
